DataElement.preferredName: Surgically-Created Resection Cavity Shave Excision Surgical Margin Removed Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Yes/No indication of whether additional tissue circumferentially around the cavity left by partial mastectomy has been resected.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Surgically-Created Resection Cavity Shave Excision Surgical Margin Removed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The space that is left after the surgical removal of a body part or tumor._A surgical procedure where thin slices are remove with or as if with a plane._One of the criteria for assessment of the effectiveness of given surgical procedure in achieving the local control of a neoplasm and the adequacy of tumor removal. It is defined by the tissue plane through which the dissection has been done and the actual or potential neoplastic tissue which has been left outside the boundary of a resected specimen within the patient. There are four types of surgical margins: intracapsular or intralesional, marginal, wide, and radical._Taken out of, separated from, or eliminated.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Surgically-Created Resection Cavity Shave Excision Surgical Margin
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The space that is left after the surgical removal of a body part or tumor.:A surgical procedure where thin slices are remove with or as if with a plane.:One of the criteria for assessment of the effectiveness of given surgical procedure in achieving the local control of a neoplasm and the adequacy of tumor removal. It is defined by the tissue plane through which the dissection has been done and the actual or potential neoplastic tissue which has been left outside the boundary of a resected specimen within the patient. There are four types of surgical margins: intracapsular or intralesional, marginal, wide, and radical.

Concepts.definition: The space that is left after the surgical removal of a body part or tumor.
A surgical procedure where thin slices are remove with or as if with a plane.

One of the criteria for assessment of the effectiveness of given surgical procedure in achieving the local control of a neoplasm and the adequacy of tumor removal. It is defined by the tissue plane through which the dissection has been done and the actual or potential neoplastic tissue which has been left outside the boundary of a resected specimen within the patient. There are four types of surgical margins: intracapsular or intralesional, marginal, wide, and radical.

Property.preferredDefinition: Removed; taken out of or separated from.

Concepts.definition: Taken out of, separated from, or eliminated.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements of a patient's surgical margins.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
